content.text:
# List of national monuments of cultural heritage in Zhytomyr Oblast

List of cultural heritage monuments of national significance in Zhytomyr Oblast.
Listings
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! No. !! Photo !! Name !! Date !! Location !! Type !! Protected number
|-
| 1 ||  || Monument to poet Alexander Pushkin || 1899 || Zhytomyr, corner of vulytsia Velyka Berdychivska and Staryi bulvar || monument of monumental art || 060001-N
|-
| 2 ||  || Grave of writer and translator Borys Ten (Mykola Khomychevskyi) || 1983 || Zhytomyr, vulytsia Seletska, Smolianske Cemetery || monument of history || 060002-N
|-
| 3 ||  || Hillfort of Kotelnia mentioned in annals and settlement || 9th-13th century || Andrushivka Raion, village Stara Kotelnia (north-west side, right-bank of Huiva River, Valy tract) || monument of archaeology || 060003-N
|-
| 4 ||  || Hillfort Yaropolch mentioned in annals || 9th-13th century || Andrushivka Raion, village Yaropovychi (outside south, Zamok tract) || monument of archaeology || 060004-N
|-
| 5 ||  || Mass grave of Haidamaka insurgency participants "Koliivshchyna" || 1767 || Zhytomyr Raion, village Kodnia (outside south) || monument of history || 060005-N
|-
| 6 ||  || Hillfort || 9th-13th, 14th-?8th centuries || Zhytomyr Raion, village Stanyshivka (outside south-west, right-bank Teteriv River) || monument of archaeology || 060006-N
|-
| 7 ||  || Hillforts of Iskorosten (3) mentioned in annals, settlement, and kurgan burials (2) || 8th-18th century || Korosten Raion, Korosten (right-bank Uzh River) || monument of archaeology || 060007-N
|-
| 8 ||  || Hillforts of Horodesk (3) mentioned in annals || 3rd millennium BCE, 9th – 13th century || Korostyshiv Raion, village Horodske || monument of archaeology || 060008-N
|-
| 9 || || Hillfort of Derevych mentioned in annals || 9th – 13th century || Liubar Raion, village Velyki Derevychi (left-bank Derevychka River, Zamchyshche tract) || monument of archaeology || 060009-N
|-
| 10 || || House, in which poet and public figure Lesya Ukrainka was born and lived || 1871–1872 || Zviahel Raion, Zviahel, vulytsia Karla Marksa, 94 || monument of history || 060010-N
|-
| 11 || || Kurgan burials (2) || 9th – 13th century || Zviahel Raion, village Khodurky (right-bank Sluch River, Serbyna Hora tract) || monument of archaeology || 060011-N
|-
| 12 ||  || Hillforts of Vozviahel (2) mentioned in annals and posad || 9th – 13th century || Zviahel Raion, village Chyzhivka (outside south-east, right-bank Sluch River) || monument of archaeology || 060012-N
|-
| 13 || || Hillfort, posad, settlement and kurgan burials (2) || 9th – 13th century || Ovruch Raion, village Horodets|| monument of archaeology || 060013-N
|-
| 14 || || Hillfort and settlement || 9th – 4th century BCE, 9th – 13th century || Olevsk Raion, Olevsk || monument of archaeology || 060014-N
|-
| 15 || || Hillfort of Kolodiazhyn mentioned in annals || 12th – 13th century || Romaniv Raion, village Kolodiazhne (outside south-west, right-bank Sluch River) || monument of archaeology || 060015-N
|-
| 16 || || Hillforts of Niyatyn (2) mentioned in annals || 12th – 13th century || Ruzhyn Raion, village Yahniatyn || monument of archaeology || 060016-N
|}
References
* [http://zakon1.rada.gov.ua/laws/show/928-2009-%D0%BF/page Rada.gov.ua: Objects of cultural heritage of national significance in the State Registry of Immobile monuments of Ukraine] — 2009 Resolution of Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine.
